org.codemonkey.javareflection
Class ValueConverter

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.javareflection.ValueConverter

public final class ValueConverter
extends Object

This reflection utility class predicts (and converts) which types a specified value can be converted into. It can only do conversions of known 'common' types, which include:

  • Any Number type (Integer, Character, Double, byte, etc.)
  • String
  • Boolean
  • Character

Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException

Nested Class Summary
static class ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException
          This exception can be thrown in any of the conversion methods of ValueConverter, to indicate a value could not be converted into the target datatype.

Method Detail

isCommonType

public static boolean isCommonType(Class<?> c)
Parameters:
c - The class to inspect.
Returns:
whether given type is a known common type.

collectCompatibleTypes

public static List<Class<?>> collectCompatibleTypes(Class<?> c)
Determines to which types the specified value (its type) can be converted to. Most common types can be converted to most other common types and all types can be converted into a String using Object.toString().

Parameters:
c - The input type to find compatible conversion output types for
Returns:
The list with compatible conversion output types.

convert

public static Object[] convert(Object[] args,
                               Class<?>[] targetTypes,
                               boolean useOriginalValueWhenIncompatible)
                        throws ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException
Converts a list of values to their converted form, as indicated by the specified targetTypes.

Parameters:
args - The list with value to convert.
targetTypes - The output types the specified values should be converted into.
useOriginalValueWhenIncompatible - Indicates whether an exception should be thrown for inconvertible values or that the original value should be used instead.
Returns:
Array containing converted values where convertible or the original value otherwise.
Throws:
ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException - Thrown when unable to convert and not use the original value.

convert

public static Object convert(Object value,
                             Class<?> targetType)
                      throws ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException
Converts a single value into a target output datatype. Only input/output pairs should be passed in here according to the possible conversions as determined by collectCompatibleTypes(Class).

First checks if the input and output types aren't the same. Then the conversions are checked for and done in the following order:
  1. conversion to String
  2. conversion to any Number
  3. conversion to Boolean
  4. conversion to Character

Parameters:
value - The value to convert.
targetType - The target datatype the value should be converted into.
Returns:
The converted value according the specified target datatype.
Throws:
ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException

convert

public static Object convert(Number value,
                             Class<?> targetType)
                      throws ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException
Attempts to convert a Number to the target datatype.

NOTE: precision may be lost when converting from a wide number to a narrower number (say float to integer). These conversions are done by simply calling Number.intValue() and Number.floatValue() etc.

Parameters:
value - The number to convert.
targetType - The target datatype the number should be converted into.
Returns:
The converted number.
Throws:
ValueConverter.IncompatibleTypeException

convertEnum

public static Object convertEnum(String value,
                                 Class<? extends Enum<?>> targetType)
Attempts to convert a String to an Enum instance, by mapping to the enum's name using Enum.valueOf(Class, String).

Parameters:
value - The value, which should be the name of one instance of the given enum.
targetType - The enum type to which which we'll try to convert.
Returns:
An enum of the given type, or null otherwise.

convertNumber

public static Object convertNumber(String value,
                                   Class<? extends Number> numberType)
Attempts to convert a String to the specified Number type.

Parameters:
value - The string value which should be a number.
numberType - The Class type that should be one of Number.
Returns:
A Number subtype value converted from value (or null if value is null).

isPrimitiveNumber

public static final boolean isPrimitiveNumber(Class<?> targetType)
Returns whether a Class is a primitive number.

Parameters:
targetType - The class to check whether it's a number.
Returns:
Whether specified class is a primitive number.
